lines.content: Grace is a simple task management chatbot that helps you keep track of your todos, deadlines, and events.
You can interact with it using text commands, and it will save your tasks to your computer so that they are available the next time you use your program.
1. Download the `ip.jar` file and place it in an empty folder.
2. Open a terminal/command prompt in that folder.
3. Run the application with: java -jar grace.jar
4. Grace will greet you and wait for your commands.
Adds a simple task with only a description.
Got it, I've added this task:
Now you have 1 task in the list.
Adds a task with a description and a deadline.
Got it, I've added this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Adds a task with a description, start time, and end time.
Got it, I've added this task:
Now you have 3 tasks in the list.
Displays all tasks currently in your list.
Here are the tasks in your list:
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
Marks a task as not done.
Okay, I've marked this task as not done yet:
Removes a task from the list.
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Finds tasks containing a given keyword.
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
Bye. Hope to see you again soon.
* Represents a command that adds a task to the task list.
* Creates an AddCommand with the specified task.
* @param task the task to be added to the task list
* Executes the add command by adding the task to the task list,
* showing confirmation message to the user, and saving the updated task list.
* @param tasks   the task list to add the tasks into
* @param ui      the user interface to display messages
* @param storage the storage handler used to save tasks
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.showMessage("Got it, I've added this task:");
ui.showMessage("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
* Represents an abstract command that can be executed in the Grace application
* Each command defines its own behavior when executed.
* Executes the command with the given tasklist, user interface, and storage handler.
* @param tasks   the task list of which the command operates
* @param ui      the user interface used to display messages
* @param storage the storage handler used to load or save tasks
* @throws GraceException if the command encounters an error during execution
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws GraceException;
* Determines whether this command signals the application to exit
* @return true if the application should exit, otherwise false
* Represents a task with a deadline.
* A deadline has a description and a date/time it must be complete.
* Creates a Deadline with a specified description and due date by.
* @param description the description of the deadline task
* @param by          the due date/time of the task
* Returns the string representation of the deadline task including,
* the type, description, and due date.
* @return the string representation of the deadline task
* Represents a command that deletes a task from a task list.
* Creates a DeleteCommand with the specified task index.
* @param index the index of the task to delete (0 based)
* Executes the delete command by removing the task from the
* task list based on the index, showing a confirmation message to the user,
* and saving the updated task list.
* @param tasks   the task list of which the command operates
* @param ui      the user interface used to display messages
* @param storage the storage handler used to load or save tasks
* @throws GraceException if the proved index is out of bounds.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws GraceException {
throw new GraceException("That's not a valid task number to delete");
ui.showMessage("Now you have: " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
* Represents a task that occurs with a certain timeframe.
* Creates an Event with the specified description, start time, and end time.
* @param description the description of the event
* @param from        the start time of the event
* @param to          the end time of the event
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {

* including its type, description, start time, end time.
* @return the string representation fo a event task
* Represents a command that exits the application.
* Executes the exit command by showing the goodbye message
* @param tasks   the task list of which the command operates
* @param ui      the user interface used to display messages
* @param storage the storage handler used to load or save tasks
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Indicates that this command will cause the application to exit.
* Represents a command that finds tasks containing a specific keyword.
* Creates a FindCommand with a given keyword to search for.
* @param keyword the keyword to search for in task descriptions
* Executes the find command by searching the task list for tasks
* containing the keyword and displaying the results to the user.
* @param tasks   the task list of which the command operates
* @param ui      the user interface used to display messages
* @param storage the storage handler used to load or save tasks
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {

* Entry point for the Grace application.
* Initializes the core components storage, tasks, and ui
* and runs the main command loop.
* Creates a new Grace application instance.
* @param filePath the path to the file where tasks are stored
* Runs the main loop of the application, handles user input
* until the user calls the exit command.
* The main entry point of the program
* Represents exceptions specific to the Grace application.
* Used to indicate invalid commands or errors when handling tasks.
* Creates a new GraceException with the specified message
* @param message the message for this exception
* Represents a command that lists all the tasks in the task list.
* Executes the list command by displaying all the tasks in the task list.
* If the task list is empty, a corresponding message will be displayed
* @param tasks   the task list of which the command operates
* @param ui      the user interface used to display messages
* @param storage the storage handler used to load or save tasks
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.showMessage("Here are the tasks in your list:");
* Represents a command that marks a task as completed in the task list.
* Creates a MarkCommand with the given task index.
* @param index the index of the task to mark as done (0 based)
* Executes the mark command by marking the specified task as done,

* @param ui      the user interface used to display messages
* @param storage the storage handler used to load or save tasks
* @throws GraceException if the proved index is invalid

* Handles loading and saving tasks to a file on disk
* Provides methods that persists the task list

* Represents a generic task with a description and completion status.
* Base class for specific types of tasks.
* Creates a task with a given description.
* Task is initially marked as not done
* @param description the description of the task.
* Returns the string representation of a task,
* showing its completion status and description
* @return the string representation of a task.
* Represents a list of tasks and provides methods to manipulate and query them.
* Creates a TaskList initialized with the given tasks.
* @param tasks the initial list of tasks.
* Finds and returns all tasks whose descriptions contain the given keyword.
* @param keyword the keyword to search for
* @return a list of tasks that contain the keyword.
* Represents a simple task without a specific time or deadline.
* A Todo only has a description.
* Creates a Todo with the given description
* @param description the description of the todo task
* Returns the string representation of the todo task,
* @return the string represenation of this todo task.
* Handles user interaction for the Grace application
* Provides methods to display messages, errors, and read user input.
* Creates an Ui instance with a Scanner for reading user input.
